title.text: Word Vector/Conditional Random Field-based Chinese Spelling Error Detection for SIGHAN-2015 Evaluation

abstractContent.text: In order to detect Chinese spelling errors, especially for essays written by foreign learners, a word vector/conditional random field (CRF)-based detector is proposed in this paper.
The main idea is to project each word in a test sentence into a high dimensional vector space in order to reveal and examine their relationships by using a CRF.
The results are then utilized to constrain the time-consuming language model rescoring procedure.
Official SIGHAN-2015 evaluation results show that our system did achieve reasonable performance with about 0.601/0.564 accuracies and 0.457/0.375 F1 scores in the detection/correction levels.
